intro: Phyllanthus liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Phyllanthus liukiuensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
